extension.searchTitle: PROVIDING FOR CONGRESSIONAL DISAPPROVAL OF THE RULE SUBMITTED BY BUREAU OF CONSUMER FINANCIAL PROTECTION RELATING TO ARBITRATION AGREEMENTS; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 125

congVote.result: So the joint resolution was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection relating to ``Arbitration Agreements''
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.J. Res. 111, providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection relating to ``Arbitration Agreements'', by a recorded vote of 231 ayes to 190 noes, Roll No. 412.

United States House Joint Resolution 111 (115th Congress)
COUNTERING AMERICA'S ADVERSARIES THROUGH SANCTIONS ACT

extension.searchTitle: COUNTERING AMERICA'S ADVERSARIES THROUGH SANCTIONS ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 125

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Countering America's Adversaries Through Sanctions Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>H.R. 3364, to provide congressional review and to counter aggression by the Governments of Iran, the Russian Federation, and North Korea, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 419 yeas to 3 nays, Roll No. 413.

titleInfo.title: AMERICAN HEALTH CARE ACT OF 2017--MOTION TO PROCEED

extension.searchTitle: AMERICAN HEALTH CARE ACT OF 2017--MOTION TO PROCEED; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 125

congVote.dailyDigestSummary: Senate began consideration of H.R. 1628, to provide for reconciliation pursuant to title II of the concurrent resolution on the budget for fiscal year 2017, taking action on the following amendments and motions proposed thereto:<P/>McConnell Amendment No. 267, of a perfecting nature.<P/>Enzi (for Paul) Amendment No. 271 (to Amendment No. 267), of a perfecting nature.<P/>Donnelly motion to commit the bill to the Committee on Finance with instructions to report back with instructions.<P/>Prior to the consideration of this measure today, Senate took the following action:<P/>By 51 yeas to 50 nays, Vice President voting yea (Vote No. 167), Senate agreed to the motion to proceed to the consideration of the bill.

extension.searchTitle: AMERICAN HEALTH CARE ACT OF 2017; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 125

congVote.result: Three-fifths of the Senators duly chosen and sworn not having voted in the affirmative, the motion is rejected.
